title: Comcast's stock surges after profit, revenue rise above expectations
text: Shares of Comcast Corp. CMCSA, -0.40% rallied 2.8% in premarket trading Thursday, after the cable TV and internet provider reported third-quarter profit and revenue that rose above expectations, as strength in cable revenue offset slight misses in its NBC Universal and Sky businesses. Net income increased to $3.22 billion, or 70 cents a share, from $2.89 billion, or 62 cents a share, in the year-ago period. Excluding non-recurring items, adjusted EPS rose to 79 cents from 68 cents and beat the FactSet consensus of 74 cents. Revenue grew 21.2% to $26.83 billion, above the FactSet consensus of $26.76 billion. Cable communications revenue increased 4.0% to $14.58 billion, above the FactSet consensus of $14.44 billion, as customer relationships increased 3.4% including 309,000 net additions; NBC Universal revenue fell 3.5% to $8.30 billion, just shy of expectations of $8.32 billion; and Sky revenue declined 4.2% to $4.55 billion, to miss expectations of $4.65 billion. The stock, which is on track to open above the Sept. 12 record closing price of $46.97, has run up 34.3% year to date through Wednesday, while the S&P 500 SPX, -0.04% has gained 19.9%.
